slots.description: The element to animate. If multiple elements are to be animated, wrap them in a single container or use multiple animation elements.

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the built-in animation to use. For custom animations, use the `keyframes` prop.

members.name: play
members.description:
Plays the animation. When omitted, the animation will be paused. This prop will be automatically removed when the
animation finishes or gets canceled.

members.name: delay
members.description: The number of milliseconds to delay the start of the animation.

members.name: direction
members.description: Determines the direction of playback as well as the behavior when reaching the end of an iteration.

members.name: duration
members.description: The number of milliseconds each iteration of the animation takes to complete.

members.name: easing
members.description:
The easing function to use for the animation. This can be a Lynk easing function or a custom easing function
such as `cubic-bezier(0, 1, .76, 1.14)`.

members.name: endDelay
members.description: The number of milliseconds to delay after the active period of an animation sequence.

members.name: fill
members.description: Sets how the animation applies styles to its target before and after its execution.

members.name: iterations
members.description: The number of iterations to run before the animation completes. Defaults to `Infinity`, which loops.

members.name: iterationStart
members.description: The offset at which to start the animation, usually between 0 (start) and 1 (end).

members.name: keyframes
members.description: The keyframes to use for the animation. If this is set, `name` will be ignored.

members.name: playbackRate
members.description:
Sets the animation's playback rate. The default is `1`, which plays the animation at a normal speed. Setting this
to `2`, for example, will double the animation's speed. A negative value can be used to reverse the animation. This
value can be changed without causing the animation to restart.

members.name: currentTime
members.description: Gets and sets the current animation time.

members.name: cancel
members.description: Clears all KeyframeEffects caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

members.name: finish
members.description: Sets the playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

events.description: Emitted when the animation is canceled.
events.name: on:cancel

events.description: Emitted when the animation finishes.
events.name: on:finish

events.description: Emitted when the animation starts or restarts.
events.name: on:start

members.description:
The length of time, in milliseconds, the alert will show before closing itself. If the user interacts with
the alert before it closes (e.g. moves the mouse over it), the timer will restart. Defaults to `Infinity`.

members.name: toast
members.description:
Displays the alert as a toast notification. This will move the alert out of its position in the DOM and, when
dismissed, it will be removed from the DOM completely. By storing a reference to the alert, you can reuse it by
calling this method again. The returned promise will resolve after the alert is hidden.

members.name: type
members.description:
The type of button. When the type is `submit`, the button will submit the surrounding form. Note that the default
value is `button` instead of `submit`, which is opposite of how native `<button>` elements behave.

members.description: When set, the underlying button will be rendered as an `<a>` with this `href` instead of a `<button>`.

members.name: target
members.description: Tells the browser where to open the link. Only used when `href` is set.

members.name: download
members.description: Tells the browser to download the linked file as this filename. Only used when `href` is set.

members.name: form
members.description:
The "form owner" to associate the button with. If omitted, the closest containing form will be used instead. The
value of this attribute must be an id of a form in the same document or shadow root as the button.

members.description: Used to override the form owner's `method` attribute.

members.description: Used to override the form owner's `novalidate` attribute.

members.description: Used to override the form owner's `target` attribute.

members.name: open
members.description: Indicates whether or not the drawer is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

members.name: label
members.description:
The drawer's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using
`no-header`, as it is required for proper accessibility.

members.name: placement
members.description: The direction from which the drawer will open.

members.name: contained
members.description:
By default, the drawer slides out of its containing block (usually the viewport). To make the drawer slide out of
its parent element, set this prop and add `position: relative` to the parent.

members.name: noHeader
members.description:
Removes the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the drawer.

members.name: show
members.description: Shows the drawer.

members.name: hide

members.description:
By default, the dropdown is closed when an item is selected. This attribute will keep it open instead. Useful for
controls that allow multiple selections.

members.description: The dropdown will close when the user interacts outside of this element (e.g. clicking).

members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

members.name: skidding
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

members.description: Display the dropdown component as a block instead of inline-block.

members.name: hoist
members.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with

members.name: typeToSelect
members.description:
Initiates type-to-select logic, which automatically selects an option based on what the user is currently typing.
The event passed will be used to append the appropriate characters to the internal query and the selection will be
updated. After a brief period, the internal query is cleared automatically. This is useful for enabling
type-to-select behavior when the menu doesn't have focus.

The popover's label as displayed in the header. You should always include a relevant label even when using

members.name: noHeader
members.description:
Disables the header. This will also remove the default close button, so please ensure you provide an easy,
accessible way for users to dismiss the popover.

members.name: noArrow
members.description: Hides the arrow.

members.name: clickToHide
members.description: Hide the popover by clicking outside the panel.

members.description:
The preferred placement of the popover panel. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the panel
inside of the viewport.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the popover so the panel will not open.

members.name: containingElement
members.description: The popover will close when the user interacts outside of this element (e.g. clicking).

members.name: distance
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel away from its trigger.

members.name: skidding
members.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the panel along its trigger.

members.name: block
members.description: Display the popover component as a block instead of inline-block.

members.name: hoist
members.description:
Enable this option to prevent the panel from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|scroll`.

members.description: Shows the popover panel.

members.name: hide
members.description: Hides the popover panel

is activated.

attributes.description:
The preferred placement of the tooltip. Note that the actual placement may vary as needed to keep the tooltip
inside of the viewport.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the tooltip so it won't show when triggered.

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip away from its target.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether or not the tooltip is open. You can use this in lieu of the show/hide methods.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the tooltip along its target.

attributes.name: no-arrow
attributes.description: Hides the arrow.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Controls how the tooltip is activated. Possible options include `click`, `hover`, `focus`, and `manual`. Multiple
options can be passed by separating them with a space. When manual is used, the tooltip must be activated
programmatically.

attributes.name: hoist
attributes.description:
Enable this option to prevent the tooltip from being clipped when the component is placed inside a container with
`overflow: auto|hidden|scroll`.

animations.name: tooltip.show
animations.description: The animation to use when showing the tooltip.

animations.name: tooltip.hide
animations.description: The animation to use when hiding the tooltip.

slots.description: The content you'd like to be visually hidden.

package.name: @lynk-design/lynk
package.description: A library of web components and styles for building web applications with the Edgio Streaming design language.
package.author: Harley Jessop
